integrated_with_scenario.description: Set to true only if the track has been integrated with the CTF scenario. This means that Eric Boivin wrote/modified the posts.

contacts.description: Handles or real names. Ex: Ã‰milio Gonzalez or Res260

qa.description: Who helped do quality assurance for the track.

support.description: Who can provide support during the CTF for the track.

services.description: List of network services used by the track.

name.description: Name of the network service. Example: Tomcat Web Server. Must be unique in the track. Only use lowercase letters, numbers and dashes.

address.description: IPv6 address of the network service.

port.description: Port number where the network service listens on.

check.description: Type of check to do to make sure this service is up and alert us during the CTF if it's down.

dev_port_mapping.description: During development, this service will be accessible from localhost:<value>. This allows to access the services outside the host (for example from the Windows Host if using WSL or from your host machine if using GitHub Codespaces).

flags.description: The list of flags in the track.

value.description: The value of the flag. Minimum: 0.

description.description: INTERNAL description of the flag. Example: Free flag in source of index.php.

return_string.description: The text the participants see AFTER they submit the flag. Example: [mytrackname] 1/1 Good job! Track completed.

tags.description: Askgod tags for this flag. Use tag `discourse: sometriggername` to define triggers for posts in the posts/ directory.

discourse.description: Discourse trigger for this flag. This value can be used in a discourse post defined in the posts/ directory to post a message when this flag is submitted.

ui_sound.description: Fireworks sound trigger for this flag. This value can be used to trigger a specific sound in the timeline when this flag is submitted. The chosen file can be any of the default ones which can be found at https://github.com/nsec/askgod-webui/blob/master/components/Fireworks.vue#L72-L88 or new ones added in "challenges/your-track/files/askgod/sounds/*.mp3".

ui_gif.description: Fireworks gif trigger for this flag. This value can be used to trigger a specific gif in the timeline when this flag is submitted. The chosen file can be any of the default ones which can be found at https://github.com/nsec/askgod-webui/blob/master/components/Fireworks.vue#L39-L70 or new ones added in "challenges/your-track/files/askgod/gifs/*.gif".
